extends java.lang.Object

getProviderID

public org.openrdf.model.URI getProviderID()
RDF resource identifying the provider as context

getContextExpirationTimeMS

public long getContextExpirationTimeMS()
determines how long a context is kept in the store. Default is 0 which means the data is queried fully from the provider and the previous data is replaced completely With data sources that are looked up dynamically, we can set this value in the provider in oder to determine how long data is cached TODO: In principle, this is exactly the same as the poll interval - if the interval has not yet passed, we do not need to rerun Consider getting rid of this variable (or the other way around - we could check the context expiration time instead of the poll interval for the regular providers)

check

public boolean check(T config)
Description copied from interface: PojoConfigurable
given a config, determines whether the operation can be performed. this is even more fine grained than getRequiredProps(), since there might be requirement that one of 2 optional params must be given. This cannot be expressed via getRequiredProps

Specified by:
check in interface PojoConfigurable<T extends java.io.Serializable>

setParameter

public void setParameter(java.lang.String parameter)
allows the UI to set one additional parameter in addition to location, user and pwd. For instance, the SPARQL Provider can override this method and map the parameter to its query

public java.lang.String getParameter()

getConfigurablesClass

public java.lang.Class<?> getConfigurablesClass()
Description copied from interface: Configurable
Get the class of the configurable. In case of the widget config it's in the widget field of the config. In case of providers it's the class of the configurable

Specified by:
getConfigurablesClass in interface Configurable

getConfigurationClass

public java.lang.Class<?> getConfigurationClass()
Description copied from interface: Configurable
Get the class of the configurable's config. It's the configClass of the instantiated widget or provider
